glsa.title: Xfig: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: Two vulnerabilities have been found in Xfig, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code or Denial of Service.

background.p: Xfig is an interactive drawing tool.

description.p: A stack-based buffer overflow and a stack consumption vulnerability have been found in Xfig.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially-crafted file, potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution or a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Xfig users should upgrade to the latest version:
